sen.j: 一忠（いっちゅう、生没年不詳）は、南北朝時代 (日本)に活躍した田楽能役者。
sen.e: Icchu (it is not known when he was born nor when he died) was a Dengaku (refer to the descriptions below) and Noh player who was active in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (in Japan).
Icchu (years of birth and death unknown) was a Dengaku (refer to the descriptions below) and Noh player who was active in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (in Japan).
Icchu (year of birth and death unknown) was a Dengaku (refer to the descriptions below) and Noh player who was active in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (in Japan).
sen.cmt: 生没年不詳 year of birth and death unknown用語統一リストより訂正しました。

sen.j: 当時を代表する名人であり、猿楽から出て能を大成した観阿弥・世阿弥父子に大きな影響を与えた。
sen.e: He was an expert in the field concerned and affected considerably Kanami and Zeami, the father and his son who started with surrogacy (a form of theatre popular in Japan during the 11th to 14th centuries) and established Noh.

He was an expert in the field concerned and had considerable effect on Kanami and Zeami, the father and son who started with surrogacy (a form of theatre popular in Japan during the 11th to 14th centuries) and established Noh.

He was an expert in the field concerned and had considerable effect on Kanami and Zeami, the father and son who started with surrogacy (a form of theatre popular in Japan during the 11th to 14th centuries) and established Noh.

sen.j: 鬼など各種の物真似芸に通じさらに舞歌幽玄の風を兼ね備えた名人だった。
sen.e: He was good at mimic plays, for example, mimicking an ogre, and was an expert provided with subtle and profound airs in his dances and songs as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was good at mimic plays; for example, mimicking an ogre, and was an expert in providing subtle and profound airs in his dances and songs as well.
He was good at mimic plays; for example, mimicking an ogre, and was an expert in providing subtle and profound airs in his dances and songs as well.

sen.j: 世阿弥が『風姿花伝』で「此道の聖」、『三道』で「三体相応の達人」と絶賛している。
sen.e: Therefore, Zeami praised him greatly as 'a saint in this field' in "Fushikaden" (Flowering spirit) and as 'an expert in the three aspects of a play (dancing, singing and subtle and profound airs)' in "Sando."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, Zeami praised him greatly as 'a saint in this field' in "Fushikaden" (Flowering spirit) and as 'an expert in the three aspects of a play (dancing, singing, and subtle and profound airs)' in "Sando."

Therefore, Zeami praised him greatly as 'a saint in this field' in "Fushikaden" (Flowering spirit) and as 'an expert in the three aspects of a play' (dancing, singing, and subtle and profound airs) in "Sando."
sen.cmt: 全角の括弧を半角にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。括弧の位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 田楽とは、元々田植えに際してそれを囃した民間芸能が、平安時代に唐から渡来した散楽系の曲芸的な技を受け入れて専業化したものとされる。
sen.e: It is said that originally Dengaku was a traditional local entertainment performed in planting rice, but became specialized as an entertainment by introducing acrobatic techniques of the Sangaku style brought to Japan from Tang (in China) in the Heian period.

It is said that originally Dengaku was a traditional local entertainment performed in planting rice, but became a specialized form of entertainment by introducing acrobatic techniques of the Sangaku style brought to Japan from Tang (in China) in the Heian period.

It is said that originally Dengaku was a traditional local entertainment performed in planting rice, but became a specialized form of entertainment by introducing acrobatic techniques of the Sangaku style brought to Japan from Tang (in China) in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 猿楽とは互いに影響を与え合い、猿楽能、田楽能としてともに「能」の名で呼ばれた。
sen.e: Sarugaku and Dengaku were interacted with each other, and were called Sarugaku-Noh and Dengaku-Noh, respectively, with the term of "Noh" additionally.
Sarugaku and Dengaku interacted with each other, and were called Sarugaku-Noh and Dengaku-Noh, respectively, with the term "Noh" added.
Sarugaku and Dengaku interacted with each other, and were called Sarugaku-Noh and Dengaku-Noh, respectively, with the term "Noh" added.

sen.j: 猿楽より早く、芸能集団としての「座」を組織した。
sen.e: In Dengaku, "Za," an organization of entertainers, had been organized earlier than in Sarugaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Dengaku, "Za," an organization of entertainers, had been organized earlier than in Sarugaku.
In Dengaku, 'Za,' an organization of entertainers, had been organized earlier than in Sarugaku.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 南北朝期には京都白河 (洛外)の本座（一忠など）、奈良の新座（喜阿弥、増阿弥など）が知られていた。
sen.e: It is known that in the Northern and Southern Dynasties period, there were Hon-za (literally, a genuine organization) (by Icchu and others) in Shirakawa of Kyoto (outside of the capital, Kyoto) and Shin-za (literally, a new organization) in Nara.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is known that in the Northern and Southern Dynasties period, there were Hon-za (literally, a genuine organization) (by Icchu and others) in Shirakawa of Kyoto (outside of the capital, Kyoto) and Shin-za (literally, a new organization) in Nara.

It is known that in the period of Northern and Southern Courts, there were Hon-za (literally, a genuine organization) (by Icchu and others) in Shirakawa of Kyoto (outside of the capital, Kyoto) and Shin-za (literally, a new organization) in Nara.
sen.cmt: in the period of Northern and Southern Courtsに訂正しました。

sen.j: 南北朝期、田楽能は猿楽を圧倒して最盛期を迎える。
sen.e: In the Northern and Southern Dynasties period, Dengaku reached the peak of its activities, overwhelming Sarugaku.
In the Northern and Southern Dynasties period, Dengaku reached the peak of its activities, overwhelming Sarugaku.
In the period of Northern and Southern Courts, Dengaku reached the peak of its activities, overwhelming Sarugaku.
sen.cmt: in the period of Northern and Southern Courtsに訂正しました。

sen.j: 北条高時の田楽狂いは『太平記』において克明に描写されて有名だが、そんな時代を担った名人が一忠であった。
sen.e: How crazy Takatoki HOJO was about Dengaku is famous, because the situation was depicted in details in "Taiheiki" (The Record of the great peace), and it was Icchu who played a principal part in such an era.

How crazy Takatoki HOJO was about Dengaku is well known, because the situation was depicted in detail in "Taiheiki" (The Record of the great peace), and Icchu who played a principal part in such an era.

How crazy Takatoki HOJO was about Dengaku is well known, because the situation was depicted in detail in "Taiheiki" (The Record of the great peace), and Icchu who played a principal part in such an era.

sen.j: その生涯についてはほとんど明らかでない。
sen.e: Little is known about his life.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Little is known about his life.
Little is known about his life.

sen.j: しかし、田楽本座所属の役者として活躍して高い評価を受けていたことが、世阿弥の著作などで知られている。
sen.e: However, it is known through Zeami's writing that he worked actively as a player belonging to Dengaku Honza and his play was evaluated highly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it is known through Zeami's writing that he worked actively as a player belonging to Dengaku Honza and his plays were evaluated highly.
However, it is known through Zeami's writing that he worked actively as a player belonging to Dengaku Honza and his plays were evaluated highly.

sen.j: 『太平記』などには、貞和5年（1349年）に大規模な勧進能田楽が催されたことが記録されている。
sen.e: In "Taiheiki" and others, it is recorded that a big-scaled Kanjin Noh Dengaku (No and Denraku performances held to raise subscriptions for the construction of shrines, temples or others) were held in 1394.

In "Taiheiki" and others, it is recorded that large-scaled Kanjin Noh Dengaku (No and Denraku performances held to raise subscriptions for the construction of shrines, temples or others) were held in 1394.

In "Taiheiki" and others, it is recorded that large-scaled Kanjin Noh Dengaku (No and Denraku performances held to raise subscriptions for the construction of shrines, temples or others) were held in 1394.
sen.cmt: 全角を半角に訂正しました。

sen.j: これは京四条橋の建設の資金集めとして興行された。
sen.e: The Noh and Dengaku play was held to raise subscriptions for constructing the Shijo bridge in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Noh and Dengaku play was held to raise subscriptions for constructing the Shijo bridge in Kyoto.
The Noh and Dengaku play was held to raise subscriptions for constructing the Shijo bridge in Kyoto.

sen.j: 四条河原で本座・新座両座の出演で行われたものであり、征夷大将軍足利尊氏、関白二条良基なども観劇に訪れている。
sen.e: This play was performed by players at Hon-za and by those at Shin-za at Shijo Gawara, and was visited and viewed by Sei taishogun (literally, "great general who is to subdue the eastern barbarians") Takauji ASHIKAGA and Yoshimoto NIJO, chief adviser to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This play was performed by players at Hon-za and by those at Shin-za at Shijo Gawara, and was visited and viewed by Sei taishogun (literally, "great general who is to subdue the eastern barbarians") Takauji ASHIKAGA and Yoshimoto NIJO, chief adviser to the Emperor.

This play was performed by players at Hon-za and by those at Shin-za at Shijo Gawara, and was visited and viewed by Sei taishogun (literally, "great general who is to subdue the eastern barbarians") Takauji ASHIKAGA and Yoshimoto NIJO, chief adviser to the Emperor.

sen.j: 当時の田楽の人気の高さを示す興行である。
sen.e: This performance indicates how popular Dengaku was at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This performance indicates how popular Dengaku was at that time.
This performance indicates how popular Dengaku was at that time.

sen.j: しかし、出演した稚児のアクロバティックな芸が観客を熱狂させたあまりに、観客席の桟敷が倒壊して死傷者が出たことで「桟敷崩れの能」として現在では知られている。
sen.e: However, the performance is now known as "The Noh where the audience floor collapsed," because the acrobatic performance of a child performer made the audience so crazy that the audience floor collapsed, killing or injuring some of them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the performance is now known as "The Noh where the audience floor collapsed," because the acrobatic performance of a child performer made the audience so crazy that the audience floor collapsed, killing or injuring some of them.

However, the performance is now known as 'The Noh where the audience floor collapsed,' because the acrobatic performance of a child performer made the audience so crazy that the audience floor collapsed, killing or injuring some of them.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 一忠もこれにトップバッターとして出演し、新座の花夜叉なる役者と「恋の立合」なる曲をともに舞った。
sen.e: Icchu played as the first performer as well, dancing the play named "Koi no tachiai" (literally, love tachiai (for "tachiai," see below)) together with the player named Hanayasha at Shin-za.
Icchu played as the first performer as well, dancing in the play named "Koi no tachiai" (literally, love tachiai (for "tachiai," see below)) together with a player named Hanayasha at Shin-za.
Icchu played as the first performer as well, dancing in the play named 'Koi no tachiai' (literally, love tachiai (for "tachiai," see below)) together with a player named Hanayasha at Shin-za.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: これは「立合」と呼ばれる、二座の役者が同時に同じ曲を舞って、その出来を競い合うという趣向であり、役者同士の真剣勝負というべきものである。
sen.e: In "Tachiai," two players danced at the same time for the same music, competing which of them performed better, and therefore, Tachiai was an occasion in which players competed in earnest with each other.

In "Tachiai," two players danced at the same time for the same music, competing to see which of them performed better, and therefore, Tachiai was an occasion in which players competed in earnest with each other.

In 'Tachiai,' two players danced at the same time for the same music, competing to see which of them performed better, and therefore, Tachiai was an occasion in which players competed in earnest with each other.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 曲は進み、「恨みは末も通らねば……」という見せ場であっただろう台詞に二人が差し掛かった。
sen.e: The music progressed, and the performances of the two players were going to enter a highlight scene corresponding to the line of "Revenge for resentment has little been carried out----."
sen.cmt: 「恨みは末も通らねば……」： 意味不明です。
sen.e: The music progressed, and the performances of the two players were going to enter a highlight scene corresponding to the line of "Revenge for resentment has little been carried out----."
The music progressed, and the performances of the two players were going to enter a highlight scene corresponding to the line of 'Revenge for resentment has little been carried out----.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: ところがそんな重要な台詞の途中で、一忠は突然咳払いをして、扇を取り直して汗を拭い始めたのである。
sen.e: Then, in the middle of such an important line, Icchu coughed suddenly and changed his grip on the fan, and started wiping off the sweat.
Then, in the middle of such an important line, Icchu coughed suddenly, changed his grip on the fan, and started wiping off sweat.
Then, in the middle of such an important line, Icchu coughed suddenly, changed his grip on the fan, and started wiping off sweat.

sen.j: これにテンポを乱された花夜叉はこの肝心の台詞を言い損ない、大恥をかいてしまったという。
sen.e: For this, it is said that Hanayasha disturbed the tempo and failed to pronounce the important line correctly, being humiliated.
For this, it is said that Hanayasha disturbed the tempo and failed to pronounce the important line correctly, being humiliated.
For this, it is said that Hanayasha disturbed the tempo and failed to pronounce the important line correctly, being humiliated.

sen.j: 以上は『世子六十以後申楽談儀』に紹介されるエピソードである。
sen.e: What is described above is an episode included in "Zeshi rokuju igo Sarugaku dangi" (a document about Sarugaku).
What is described above is an episode included in "Zeshi rokuju igo Sarugaku dangi" (a document about Sarugaku).
What is described above is an episode included in "Zeshi rokuju igo Sarugaku dangi" (a document about Sarugaku).

sen.j: 後の世阿弥も、摂津猿楽の榎並と立合で「式三番」を舞った際、突然ぴたりと舞を止め、それに対応出来ずそのまま舞い続けた榎並に恥をかかせている。
sen.e: Later, playing "Shiki Sanban" (The three rituals) in a tachiai play with Enami, a Settsu Sarugaku player, Zeami as well completely stopped dancing abruptly, humiliating Enami who could not cope with the situation and continued dancing.

Later, playing "Shiki Sanban" (The three rituals) in a tachiai play with Enami, a Settsu Sarugaku player, Zeami as well abruptly stopped dancing, humiliating Enami, who could not cope with the situation and continued dancing.

Later, playing 'Shiki Sanban' (The three rituals) in a tachiai play with Enami, a Settsu Sarugaku player, Zeami as well abruptly stopped dancing, humiliating Enami, who could not cope with the situation and continued dancing.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 立合は役者同士の真剣勝負である。
sen.e: Tachiai is a play performed in earnest by players.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tachiai is a play performed in earnest by players.
Tachiai is a play performed in earnest by players.

sen.j: このような相手からの「仕掛け」に当意即妙に対応してみせてこそ、優れた役者であると世阿弥は語っている。
sen.e: Zeami said that a truly excellent player had to be able to cope wittily with a challenge posed by the other player.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Zeami said that a truly excellent player had to be able to cope wittily with a challenge posed by the other player.
Zeami said that a truly excellent player had to be able to cope wittily with a challenge posed by the other player.

sen.j: 上の一件は、円熟した名人であった一忠が花夜叉を圧倒したものと言うべきであろう。
sen.e: The episode described above can be said indicating that Icchu, an experienced expert player, overwhelmed Hanayasha.
The episode described above can be said to indicate that Icchu, an experienced expert player, overwhelmed Hanayasha.
The episode described above can be said to indicate that Icchu, an experienced expert player, overwhelmed Hanayasha.

sen.j: 幼少期から活動していた世阿弥がその芸を直接観ていないと述べている。
sen.e: Zeami, who played actively from a young age, described that he did not see Icchu's play directly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Zeami, who played actively from a young age, described that he did not see Icchu's play directly.
Zeami, who played actively from a young age, described that he did not see Icchu's play directly.

sen.j: したがって、1370年ごろには既に一線を退くか、故人だったと見られる。
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered that Icchu had been retired from his play life or had been dead by around 1370.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered that Icchu had been retired from his play life or had been dead by around 1370.
Therefore, it is considered that Icchu had been retired from his play life or had been dead by around 1370.

sen.j: 『申楽談儀』によれば、観阿弥は彼のことを「わが風体の師」と呼んで傾倒していたらしい。
sen.e: According to "Sarugaku dangi" (Talks about Sarugaku), it is likely that Kanami devoted to Icchu, calling Icchu as 'his mentor for creating his style.'
According to "Sarugaku dangi" (Talks about Sarugaku), it is likely that Kanami devoted himself to Icchu, calling Icchu 'his mentor for creating his style.'
According to "Sarugaku dangi" (Talks about Sarugaku), it is likely that Kanami devoted himself to Icchu, calling Icchu 'his mentor for creating his style.'

sen.j: また世阿弥に大きな影響を与えた近江猿楽の犬王（道阿弥）も彼から学ぶところが多かったようである。
sen.e: It seems that Inuo (Doami), who was an Omi Sarugaku player and affected Zeami considerably, learned much from Icchu as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It seems that Inuo (Doami), who was an Omi Sarugaku player and affected Zeami considerably, learned much from Icchu as well.
It seems that Inuo (Doami), who was an Omi Sarugaku player and affected Zeami considerably, learned much from Icchu as well.

sen.j: 猿楽、田楽という枠を超えて名人として崇敬されていたらしい。
sen.e: It is likely that Icchu was respected as an expert regardless of Sarugaku or Dengaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is likely that Icchu was respected as an expert regardless of Sarugaku or Dengaku.
It is likely that Icchu was respected as an expert regardless of Sarugaku or Dengaku.

sen.j: 世阿弥自身は彼の至芸には接していない。
sen.e: Zeami himself did not see Icchu's consummate play.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Zeami himself did not see Icchu's consummate play.
Zeami himself did not see Icchu's consummate play.

sen.j: しかし、幼少期から佐々木道誉・海老名南阿弥といった優れた鑑賞眼を持った人物に、その素晴らしさをたびたび聞かされ、尊敬の念が厚かった。
sen.e: However, hearing, from his young age, about his excellent plays from persons with a good ability to appreciate plays, such as Doyo SASAKI and Naami EBINA, Zeami respected Iccho deeply.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, hearing, from his young age, about his excellent plays from persons with a good ability to appreciate plays, such as Doyo SASAKI and Naami EBINA, Zeami respected Iccho deeply.
However, hearing, from his young age, about his excellent plays from persons with a good ability to appreciate plays, such as Doyo SASAKI and Naami EBINA, Zeami respected Iccho deeply.

sen.j: 「此道の聖」「三体相応の達人」と評したたことは前に述べた。
sen.e: It was described above that Zeami evaluated him as "a saint in this field" and as "an expert in the three aspects of a play."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was described above that Zeami evaluated him as "a saint in this field" and as "an expert in the three aspects of a play."
It was described above that Zeami evaluated him as 'a saint in this field' and as 'an expert in the three aspects of a play.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 更に、『申楽談儀』冒頭でも、喜阿弥・犬王・観阿弥とならぶ「当道の先祖」四人の筆頭格として名を挙げている。
sen.e: In addition, in the initial part of Sarugaku dangi (Talks about Sarugaku), Iccho was listed as a head of "the four founders of this field" who included Kiami, Inuo and Kanami as well as Iccho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition, in the initial part of Sarugaku dangi (Talks about Sarugaku), Iccho was listed as a head of "the four founders of this field," along with Kiami, Inuo, and Kanami.
In addition, in the initial part of "Sarugaku dangi" (Talks about Sarugaku), Iccho was listed as a head of 'the four founders of this field,' along with Kiami, Inuo, and Kanami.
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 世阿弥の目指した名人像の一つであり、能の芸術的発展にも、大きく寄与したと言える。
sen.e: Iccho constituted an image of experts to be aimed at by Zeami, and it can be said that Iccho contributed greatly to artistic advancement of Noh.
Iccho constituted an image of experts to be aimed at by Zeami, and it can be said that Iccho contributed greatly to the artistic advancement of Noh.
